cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SE of Fort Lauderdale, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest along the northwestern Bahamas and expected to skirt or parallel Florida’s east coast before turning north-northwest, then north and northeast toward Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the east-central Florida coast between Boca Raton and the Volusia/Flagler County line

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet to Ponte Vedra Beach FL (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton to Volusia/Flagler County Line FL (Hurricane Warning); North of Ocean Reef to south of Boca Raton FL (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coast from Miami through Palm Beach and northward to Daytona, as well as the Northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (39–73 mph) likely, with a 35% chance of sustained 50 kt (58 mph) winds; strongest winds expected Sunday afternoon through late evening with gusts potentially reaching hurricane strength in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Watch in effect; 1–3 ft of surge possible along the Palm Beach County shoreline at high tide, locally higher in inlets but generally not expected to exceed 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rainfall with local peaks of 6 inches could produce urban and flash flooding in the Palm Beach area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning overnight; short-fused tornado threat in outer rain bands.
